revised_title: Influence of Heat and Dilution on the Voltaic Pile's Electric Current
tldr: Michael Faraday investigates the source of power in the voltaic pile and how various factors, such as heat and dilution, affect the electric current produced. He concludes that the electricity of the pile originates from the chemical force of the acting bodies and that heat has a significant influence on the electric current. Faraday also examines the phenomena of thermo-electricity and disproves the existence of contact electromotive force.
